generif.text: Human FOXN6 gene was identified within human genome sequence RP11-167P23 (

we observed that the highly expressed FOXR2 in breast and overexpression of FOXR2 was positively associated with the progression and poor prognosis in patients with breast cancer, which indicated that FOXR2 might serve as a valuable prognosis biomarker for breast cancer individuals.

FOXR2 is frequently upregulated in hepatocellular carcinoma specimens compared with neighboring non-cancerous tissues in both messenger RNA and protein. It promoted cell growth and colony formation, and it facilitated tumor xenograft growth. beta-catenin, Skp2, c-Myc, and Gli-1 are the potential downstream effectors of FOXR2.
FOXR2 acts with MYC to promote cancer cell proliferation, which is a potential tumor-specific target for therapeutic intervention against MYC-driven cancers.
Knockdown of FOXR2 significantly down-regulated the protein expression levels of beta-catenin.
our data suggested that FOXR2 significantly promoted proliferation, invasion, and EMT of CRC cells. All these findings provided evidence for the role of FOXR2 as an oncogene in CRC development.
FOXR2 was up-regulated and significantly associated with poor endometrial adenocarcinoma prognosis.  FOXR2 is a target gene of miR-202.
FOXR2 might be considered as a promising therapeutic target for non-small cell lung cancer treatment.

Study found that FoxR2 is frequently upregulated in ovarian cancer (OC) and associated with worse histologic grade and poor survival. FOXR2 expression was related to cell growth, migration, and epithelial-mesenchymal transition, whereas its silencing suppressed the malignant phenotype. Angiogenesis was also stimulated by FoxR2 overexpression by enhancing VEGF expression.
CircABCB10 promotes non-small cell lung cancer cell proliferation and migration by regulating the miR-1252/FOXR2 axis.
FOXR2 up-regulation can promote the proliferation and inhibit the apoptosis of prostate cancer cells because that HOTAIR restrains the expression of miR-152
Down-regulation of FOXR2 inhibits hypoxia-driven ROS-induced migration and invasion of thyroid cancer cells via regulation of the hedgehog pathway.
The tumor suppressor NOR1 suppresses cell growth, invasiveness, and tumorigenicity in glioma.
The Relationship of FOXR2 Gene Expression Profile with Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition Related Markers in Epithelial Ovarian Cancer.
Long noncoding RNA LINC00520 accelerates lung adenocarcinoma progression via miR-1252-5p/FOXR2 pathway.
Molecular analysis of pediatric CNS-PNET revealed nosologic heterogeneity and potent diagnostic markers for CNS neuroblastoma with FOXR2-activation.
E3 ubiquitin ligase PJA1 regulates lung adenocarcinoma apoptosis and invasion through promoting FOXR2 degradation.
FOXR2 Is an Epigenetically Regulated Pan-Cancer Oncogene That Activates ETS Transcriptional Circuits.
Insights into the molecular roles of FOXR2 in the pathology of primary pediatric brain tumors.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

MF.term: DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific

name: forkhead box R2
summary: Enables sequence-specific double-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleoplasm. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
